citation.article-title: Proposals of Sphingomonas paucimobilis gen. nov. and comb. nov., Sphingomonas parapaucimobilis sp. nov., Sphingomonas yanoikuyae sp. nov., Sphingomonas adhaesiva sp. nov., Sphingomonas capsulata comb. nov., and two genospecies of the genus Sphingomonas.

p.s: Description of Sphingomonas adhaesiva sp. onv.
Sphingomonas adhaesiva (ad. hae. siva. L. adhaerere adhere; adhaesiva intended to mean sticking to the agar medium)
Circular and yellow-pigmented colonies stick to agar medium, but corrosion was not observed.
Blackening of lead acetate paper and growth on Simmons' citrate medium are negative.
In addition to the activites fo deoxyribonuclease and chymotrypsin, acid production of OF medium from glycerol and rhamnose are positive.
Assimilates fructose, mannose, and D-turanose, but not L-arabinose, D-xylose, galactose, salicin, and caplate.
Major long-chain bases are d-18:0 (59%) and d-21:1 (26%); major fatty acids are cis-18:1 (46%) and 2-OH-14:0 (23%).
16S rRNA nucleotide difference from the type strain of S. paucimobilis is 10.
G+C content of DNA is 67.2 mol%.
It was isolated from ultraviolet-irradiated water at a surgical operation room.
